Rock Band 3 out this holiday, will “revolutionize” genre

March 9th, 2010 @ 19:52
By Patrick Garratt

Harmonix just confirmed that Rock Band 3 will release this holiday season.

Said the firm on Rock Band’s Facebook page:

“Harmonix is developing Rock Band 3 for worldwide release this holiday season! The game, which will be published by MTV Games and distributed by Electronic Arts, will innovate and revolutionize the music genre once again, just as Harmonix did with the original Rock Band, Rock Band 2 and The Beatles: Rock Band. Stay tuned for more details!”

There’s no more detail right now, but keep watching for updates from GDC.

Posted in: EA, GDC 2010, Hot, Rhythm action

    “Rock Band 3 will be the last Rock Band / GH / etc game I buy. There’s really no need for constant sequels.”

    1) There are not (constant sequels) of Rock Band. Rock Band 2 was released in 2008.

    2) Why would it be the last one you buy consider it will have a completely new track list with likely in the region of 100 songs? Especially if lets you import your songs from the first two games? Just consider how many songs that is…

    3) There are “upgrade packs”. But that would be a retarded way to focus on the franchise. It would not only fail to keep interest in the franchise going, since sequels build continued interest, but it would also limit their ability to add new features to the series.

  24. Psychotext said:

    March 10, 2010 at 12:17 am

    I’ve already most of that… but here it is again:

    1) Other than Rock Band 2, there’s Lego, Beatles and coming soon, Green Day. Spinoffs, perhaps… but they’re still essentially the same game with different music. From my point of view, I’ve seen one of these every year.

    2007 – Rock Band
    2008 – Rock Band 2
    2009 – Beatles / Lego Rock Band
    2010 – Rock Band 3

    Is there really a need for this to be a yearly franchise? We’re not talking about Madden or Fifa here.

    2) Because I have no interest in most of the songs on the disc. I’d rather continue to buy a songs here and there… ones I know I like.

    3) I don’t really care about their business model. Nor if I’m honest do I particularly care about new features. All I really care about are new songs. Also, if there are upgrade packs, I haven’t seen them (unless you’re talking about song packs, which are something else).

    But let me be clear… I don’t expect people to agree, this is just how I (I’d make that bold, but there’s little point) feel about it. There’s really nothing I could see RB4, RB5, RB6 etc giving me that RB2 doesn’t. Hence, I wont be buying any more of the games in future.
